title: Interpret confidence level for mean monthly rent

content.question: Monthly rent was determined for each apartment in a random sample of 100 apartments. The sample mean was $820 and the sample standard deviation was $25. An approximate 95 percent confidence interval for the true mean monthly rent for the population of apartments from which this sample was selected is ($815, $825). Which of the following statements is a correct interpretation of the 95 percent confidence level?

choices.label: In this population, about 95 percent of all rental prices are between $815 and $825.
In this sample, about 95 percent of the 100 rental prices are between $815 and $825.
In repeated sampling, the method produces intervals that include the population mean approximately 95 percent of the time.
In repeated sampling, the method produces intervals that include the sample mean approximately 95 percent of the time.
There is a probability of 0.95 that the true mean is between $815 and $825.

content.answer: In repeated sampling, the method produces intervals that include the population mean approximately 95 percent of the time.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
